title: $$\frac{Equation}{Substitute}$$
text: The equation for calculuating the rate of change is $$\frac{f{\left(x_1\right)}-f{\left(x_2\right)}}{x_1-x_2}$$. So to find the answer, we can start by plugging in $$x+h$$ for $$x_1$$ and $$x$$ for $$x_2$$, and we get the expression $$\frac{{2\left(x+h\right)}^2+1-2x^2+1}{x+h-x}$$.
speech: The equation for calculuating the rate of change is  fraction, f of, parentheses x sub 1  minus, f of, parentheses x sub 2 , over, x sub 1 minus x sub 2,  . So to find the answer, we can start by plugging in  x plus h  for  x sub 1  and  x  for  x sub 2 , and we get the expression  fraction, 2 times, parentheses x plus h,  squared plus 1 minus 2 x squared, plus 1, over, x plus h minus x,  .

title: Simplify
text: Simplify the expression $$\frac{{2\left(x+h\right)}^2+1-2x^2+1}{x+h-x}$$. What do you get?
